revised_title: Experiments on Dyeing Black with Lime and Astringents
tldr: The author, James Clegg, conducted experiments to determine the effectiveness of lime and astringents in dyeing black. He found that lime deepened the color produced by some astringents but did not improve color preservation. The author also discovered that a slight boiling was preferable for creating durable colors. Additionally, he found that adding pearl ashes to astringent mixtures produced deeper black colors.
